description.narrative: Goal (Impact): To contribute for achieving improved food and nutrition security at household level. Purpose (Outcome): Sustainably improved productivity and income of 9,600 smallholders (7941 Male and 1659 FHH) and 1860 women and youth by 50% through effective and gender equitable productive resources utilization by the end of the project period. Applicable top level indicators: By the end of the project average productivity of selected high value crops(Teff, Maize, Mung-Bean, Carrot and Onion) increased from 12.7 to 19 qt/hao Field crops: 10.68 to 16 qt/hao Vegetables: 92.66 to 139 qt/ha By the end of the project average annual income of target households increased from 7,746 to 11,620 ETB.o Smallholders: from 9,437 to 13,401 ETB.o Women and youth: 3,238 to 6,867 ETB.

Objectives: Approx. 2150 smallholder irrigators will produce and supply high value crops to the market 2) Increasing households income s 3) Improve household gender relation 4 Based on HARVEST improve ORDA's ability to serve the poor in rural Amhara

description.narrative: --> By the end of the project average productivity of selected high value crops (Teff, Maize, Mung-Bean, Carrot and Onion) increased from 12.7 to 37 quintal/hectare- Field crops increased from 10.68 to 17.71 quintal/hectare- Vegetables from 92.66 to 163 quintal/hectare --> By the end of the project average annual income of target households had increased from ETB 7,746 to ETB 36,915- Smallholder farmers income increased from ETB 9,437 to ETB 39,856, and - Women and youth income increased from ETB 3,238 to ETB 25,120
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
